DOCNAME: STEPHENS v. CYPRUS, TURKEY AND THE UNITED NATIONS
JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP and NORP national who was born in GPE and lives in GPE .
The applicant owns a house which is located in the buffer zone , at CARDINAL FAC , in the NORP GPE district in GPE . The property was transferred to the applicant on DATE by way of a donation .

From DATE until DATE an exchange of correspondence concerning the above property took place mainly between the applicant 's husband , Mr PERSON , acting on behalf of the applicant , ORG in GPE ( ORG ) and ORG in GPE ( ORG ) . In particular , the following letters were exchanged :
By a letter dated DATE Mr PERSON submitted claim forms to the LOC in respect of losses from the property .

In a letter dated CARDINAL DATE the ORG informed Mr PERSON that the property appeared to be in ORG ( ORG ) buffer zone . They asked PERSON whether he had any information as to who might have been responsible for the loss of movables from the house , and in particular , whether it could have been ORG or ORG .
By a letter dated DATE the ORG forwarded the claim forms to the “ ORG ” of the “ GPE ” ( “ GPE ” ) .

In a letter to PERSON dated CARDINAL DATE the ORG confirmed that the property was within the ORG buffer zone , that it was inaccessible and that it would not be possible to reside in the house . They further informed Mr PERSON that the “ NORP ” had rejected his claim . In this connection they noted that :

“ ' NORP - Cypriot ' rejection of claims from people with NORP , NORP or NORP origins is not a situation in which we acquiesce and we are in regular contact with the NORP - Cypriot authorities concerning properties owned by NORP nationals in the northern part of GPE , including those with NORP , NORP or NORP connections . ”

In his reply dated CARDINAL DATE Mr PERSON asked the ORG whether a claim should be made against ORG . He stated , inter alia , that ORG had had a defence post in the garden of the house and had bunked down in the garage .
In a letter dated DATE the ORG suggested that the applicant and her husband seek the advice of a lawyer in GPE should they decide to make a claim against ORG . They further noted the following :
“ To the best of our knowledge there have been no successful claims for loss or damage to movable property allegedly resulting from ORG or ORG action , ' legal proof ' being difficult to produce . ”

In a letter dated DATE the ORG requested PERSON to provide them , inter alia , with more information about the property and the history of its ownership in order to establish the status of the house and see what could be done . They also informed him that they had made an application to the relevant authorities to allow him to inspect the property .
In a letter dated DATE to the LOC concerning the applicant 's property , Lieutenant Colonel PERSON , the Chief Humanitarian Officer of ORG of ORG in GPE , stated the following :

“ I regret to inform you that compensation of any kind will not be paid by ORG . Moreover , it is not feasible to authorise the return of the property for Mr PERSON to reside in , owing to the security implications and the severe damage to the property . ”
In a letter to Mr PERSON dated DATE , ORG stated the following :

“ I have read the file on your case . I have also spoken to the Office Manager of the Humanitarian Branch of ORG in GPE who are in command of LOC . His opinion is much the same as that of Lt Col J Tisi Bana in DATE . He corrected your assumption that you would be able to sell the property to a NORP . He said it would be impossible to sell to a NORP - Cypriot as there is no access from the north boundary of LOC .

If you are in possession of the Title Deeds you would be able to sell your property . As the property was dilapidated when visited by PERSON and PERSON in DATE it will have DATE wear without repairs . There is little chance of access to the property for habitation . ”
On an unknown date Mr PERSON wrote to the Office Manager of ORG of ORG .

In a letter dated DATE the ORG informed Mr PERSON that Major PERSON from ORG of ORG had informed them that if PERSON required assistance in showing the property to a prospective buyer the ORG would be able to accompany him provided that he applied for permission and that all the legalities were met . The new purchaser , however , would not be able to have access to the property .
In an e - mail sent by ORG of the LOC to Mr PERSON on DATE the following was stated :

“ I have written DATE to ORG at ORG to request an update on the condition of your wife 's property and I will contact you in due course with the information . I have also asked them to confirm whether access to the property is still denied . Should this be the case you may like to consider contacting either a lawyer in GPE or ORG to discover if you could claim for compensation for the loss of use of the property ... ”
Subsequently , by an e - mail sent on DATE , the Property Officer informed PERSON as follows ;

“ Further to my e - mail of DATE , I can confirm that permanent access to your property is still not permitted but short visits by members of the ORG forces are allowed periodically . Under ORG escort , I visited your wife 's property on DATE . As you are aware , unfortunately the house was severely damaged during the events of DATE and DATE have seen further deterioration in the condition of the property . It is little more than a shell with rampant vegetation obscuring the garden and parts of the building . All the houses in the immediate vicinity appear to have suffered the same fate . Sadly , there does not seem to be much action that you could take until there is a solution to the GPE problem . However , you may like to obtain some legal advice on your wife 's position and I can send you a list of lawyers upon request . You may also want to contact ORG to discover if it would be feasible to lodge a claim with them ... ” .

ORG was established through ORG ( ORG ) Resolution CARDINAL ( DATE ) of CARDINAL DATE to prevent a recurrence of fighting between the NORP - Cypriot and NORP - Cypriot communities and , as necessary , to contribute to the maintenance and restoration of law and order and a return to normal conditions . The ORG reads , in so far as relevant , as follows :

“ Noting that the present situation with regard to GPE is likely to threaten international peace and security and may further deteriorate unless additional measures are promptly taken to maintain peace and to seek out a durable solution ,
Having in mind the relevant provisions of the LAW of ORG and , in particular , its LAW , ...

CARDINAL . Recommends the creation , with the consent of the Government of GPE , of ORG in GPE . The composition and the size of the ORG shall be established by the Secretary - General , in consultation with ORG , GPE , GPE and GPE and GPE . The Commander of the ORG shall be appointed by the Secretary - General and report to him . The Secretary - General , who shall keep the Government providing the ORG fully informed , shall report periodically to ORG on its operation ;

CARDINAL . Recommends that the function of the ORG should be , in the interest of preserving international peace and security , to use its best efforts to prevent a recurrence of fighting and , as necessary , to contribute to the maintenance and restoration of law and order and a return to normal conditions ;
CARDINAL . Recommends that the stationing of the ORG shall be for DATE ... ”
In his report of CARDINAL DATE the Secretary - General summarised the guiding principles of ORG , which remain in effect to DATE , as follows :

“ The ORG is under the exclusive control and command of ORG at all times . The Commander of the ORG is appointed by and responsible exclusively to the Secretary - General . The contingents comprising the ORG are integral parts of it and take their orders exclusively from the ORG Commander . The ORG undertakes no functions which are not consistent with the provisions of ORG resolution of CARDINAL DATE . The troops of the ORG carry arms which , however , are to be employed only for self - defense , should this become necessary in the discharge of its function , in the interest of preserving international peace and security , of seeking to prevent a recurrence of fighting , and contributing to the maintenance and restoration of law and order and a return to normal conditions . The personnel of the ORG must act with restraint and with complete impartiality towards the members of the NORP and NORP communities .

As regards the principle of self - defense , it is explained that the expression of self - defense includes the defense of ORG posts , LOC and vehicles under armed attack , as well as the support of other personnel of ORG under armed attack . When acting in self - defense , the principle of minimum force shall always be applied and armed force will be used only when all peaceful means of persuasion have failed . The decision as to when force may be used in these circumstances rests with the Commander on the spot . Examples in which troops may be authorized to use force include attempts by force to compel them to withdraw from a position which they occupy under orders from their commanders , attempts by force to disarm them , and attempts by force to prevent them from carrying out their responsibilities as ordered by their commanders . ”
ORG became operational on DATE .

Following the NORP invasion of DATE , the UNSC adopted a number of resolutions expanding the mandate of ORG to include , inter alia , supervising a de facto ceasefire which came into effect on DATE and maintaining a buffer zone ( between the ceasefire lines of ORG and of the NORP and NORP - Cypriot forces ) .

In DATE ORG reached an agreement with both sides , “ the Agreement on Unmanning of Positions in Sensitive Areas ” , whereby they unmanned their positions and ceased their patrols in certain sensitive locations .
In the absence of a political settlement , the mandate of ORG has been periodically extended by the ORG for periods of DATE .

ORG maintains the military status quo in the buffer zone area . It keeps constant surveillance over the buffer zone through a system of observation posts , and through air , vehicle and foot patrols .

Certain parts of the buffer zone are farmed or inhabited . There are several villages or special areas called ORG within the buffer zone where CARDINAL people live and/or work . NORP may enter these areas freely . Elsewhere in the buffer zone , civilian movement or activity require specific authorisation from the ORG .
